title: More nerfs for armor items? I don't think they can get any cheaper.
body:
2400 gold for frozen heart, 2100 gold for thornmail. The tried and true strategy of removing stats and reducing the price on armor items has reduced them to a critical low in cost. 2850 gold for Omen. 

Maybe you could try... adding cost to them? I know Riot has literally never (not even once) increased the price on a tank item, but maybe you should try it. 

Also, you already tried nerfing all armor items before. It lead to nobody playing melee and double mage meta (both times you tried.) Third time is the charm, I guess?

I think that they will probably be focusing on redistributing the costs of defensive items along with some stat changes that would benefit fighters more than tanks. For instance Frozen Heart is more obviously a Tank item whereas Randuin's is more of a Fighter oriented item. So increasing the cost of Frozen heart while lowering the cost of Randuin's (with possible tweaking of the stats). New items are being added as well and MR items are probably getting buffed (I'm thinking Hexdrinker). So with all of these things in mind, I'm thinking there might be better itemization for fighters specifically while it might hurt pure tanks a little bit.
thats not fair why hurt the tanks?

I'm not necessarily agreeing with it, but right now. Tanks just outclass fighters as they have more CC on average and similar damage when building the same items. If items favor fighters over tanks, a resurgence in fighters may occur over the tanks we have been used to seeing (even though the tank meta is currently falling out of flavor already). We'll see what happens. 

Interestingly, if you consider diminishing returns on resistances, tanks shouldn't be hurt very much if some items have a little less armor. They should be focusing on building a lot of health to compliment their resists rather than stacking armor/mr (unless you are facing certain champs like Vayne). I'm thinking the items that are going to be affected are Randuins, Frozen Heart, IBG?, Frozen Mallet, Hexdrinker, and possibly SV/Banshee's. They have announced 1 or 2 new items could be added as well, which I'm thinking might be a new Atma's and a new gapcloser item. I'm not sure what exactly this will entail, but it should be interesting. I'm excited for the changes and it should be interesting what happens.

There are no diminishing returns on resistances.

"t is a common misconception that armor has diminishing returns.

Imagine if every character started with 100 health. If this was the case, then health itemization would behave essentially identically to armor, including the value of each point. Each point of armor gives the same bonus - if 50 armor increases your survival time by 2 seconds, then 100 armor will increase it by 4.

There exist items that pierce a % of your armor/MR, but it is linear in a vacuum. The reason people claim it had diminishing returns is because the % gain from a linear bonus decreases as that value increases. That is the same with nearly every stat, though. Even damage or crit chance experience this phenomena when they are increased in isolation."

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=441938

Its kinda hard to explain since its not exactly whats perceived, but every point of armor is essentially worth the same as the last. Each point of armor increases your survival time by the same amount as the last.

Twitch could potentially get a buff because of this, though I've never seen any ADC have issues with armor late game. Most AD Assassins have 2nd or 3rd item as LW and even with armor being nerfed slightly, they'd still need it. Difference between 120 and 150 armor isn't as much as people want it to seem prior to a LW. 120 is 54.5% reduction, 150 is 60%.  5.5% damage difference. Later on, it'll become more prominent, but one big armor item won't be losing much unless they destroy it, which they won't. They have no reason to make armor be much lower than what it is considering how many champs reduce armor... J4,Wu, Xin, anything with a cleaver, etc. 

If Mr items are buffed, every AP Assassin is pretty much getting screwed. Completely. They've kept MR as something low because there isn't any % MR reductions in the game yet outside of a Void Staff. You can currently total 50 Flat MPen and 39% MPen. This is 20 flat from runes, 15 from boots, 15 from Liandry's. From there, you can reduce their MR by 20 as well with an abyssal. Beyond that, there isn't many MR reductions. There's a few like Amumu and Fiddle's passives for flats and %'s would be Kog's Q and Kayle's passive. Since Soraka and Morg both lost their own MR reducers, there isn't much left, which is why there's so little magic resist in the game. There's too little reducers and the new Abyssal they're working on is utter garbage at reducing Mr unless they fight lasts for 8 seconds or MORE since it does 5% reduced MR every 2s. Yeah, every 2s.... That means to get to a noticeable 20%, it takes 8 damn seconds. Most fights don't involve some one standing directly next to a tank for 8-12s.
